alert.note: Alert for Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore; San Francisco; San Fransisco Peninsula Coast; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued October 15 at 8:22PM PDT until October 16 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Increased threat of sneaker waves expected due to long period northwest swell. * WHERE...West and northwest facing beaches of coastal North Bay, San Francisco Peninsula Coast, San Mateo county coast, Southern Monterey Bay, and Big Sur coast. * WHEN...Until 5 AM PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Large, unexpected waves can sweep across the beach without warning, sweeping people into the sea from rocks, jetties, and beaches. These sneaker waves can also move large objects such as logs, crushing anyone caught underneath. .
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions. Don`t be fooled by an ocean that looks calm. There can be 30 minutes of small waves before a sneaker wave strikes. Avoid rocks and jetties. Avoid steep beaches. Stay much farther back from the water and never turn your back on the ocean.

area.areaDesc: Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore; San Francisco; San Fransisco Peninsula Coast; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast
